abstract: While other wireless companies waffled, AT&T said it wasn’t fair for the F.C.C. to impose new network neutrality rules on wireless networks after auctioning off spectrum with no such restrictions.
snippet: While other wireless companies waffled, AT&T said it wasn’t fair for the F.C.C. to impose new network neutrality rules on wireless networks after auctioning off spectrum with no such restrictions.
lead_paragraph: You’ve got to hand it to AT&T. They don’t like Julius Genachowski’s plan to apply network neutrality rules to wireless networks, and they aren’t shy about saying so.

headline.main: AT&T Says F.C.C. Neutrality Suggests a ‘Bait and Switch’
